channel.title: [Tut]{Photoshop} How to make Bitmap Mask![Tut]
channel.description:
[size=24pt][b]{TUT Photoshop} How to Make a Bitmap Mask by Eager.[/b][/size]
[b][size=12pt]About this tutorial.[/size][/b] This Tutorial will teach you how to make a Bitmap Mask.bmp using photoshop. [b]Now if any of you guys who dosen't have photoshop DONT PANIC :) 'cause you could get it for free![/b] :rolleyes: Using Torrent i'll give you the link.
[b][size=12pt]Procedures[/size][/b]
[b]Step 1:[/b]After obtaining Photoshop. We open it. [b]Notice: Photoshop could be obtained on this link http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,1266.0.html#post_ps[/b] <below> [img]http://img135.imageshack.us/img135/3954/pic1mc0.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Locate and open up you photoshop.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 2:[/b]After Opening up Photoshop you have to Creat a new project for pasting your destop snapshot. ( to make a snapshot you could just press the ''Print Screen Sys Rq'' button located beside your F12 button or you could press Ctrl+C+the ''Print Screen'' button.) After Click on File->New you should see a pop-up box. set the width and height in pixels of your windows. (if you dont know how big in pixels your windows is. Then Open up Scar use the color picker click on the very buttom of your windows the very button right hand corner and you should see the color and the coordintes. Type in the coordinats +1 so if i have ''Color Picked: 1381395 at (1023, 767) '' for my color picker i would type in 1024->width and 768->height in my photoshop pop-up window. <pic below> [img]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/6849/pic2yq5.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Creat a new project type in your windows width and height in pixels then press ''Ok''[/i][/size]
[b]Step 3:[/b]After crating a new blank page in photoshop we paste our windows snapshot by Ctrl+V. Then you crop the snapshot ( select the park that you want to make it into mask. example for mine i choose FireFox. you can select the part you wanted by selecting the squar like box at the very top-left of your photoshop tool bar. [img]http://img221.imageshack.us/img221/6461/pic3vd7.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]select the square like icon at the very top left hand corner of your photoshop tool bar and Select the part you wanted.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 4:[/b]To make accurate Crupting you could use the ''Zoom tool'' and click on the ''Actual Pixel'' Button. [img]http://img227.imageshack.us/img227/4412/pic4gw4.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]use the ''Zoom tool'' -> ''actual pixel'' button for more accurate cutting.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 5:[/b]Now we have to covert your image into GreyScale to do this you go to Image->Mode->Greyscale. <below> [img]http://img222.imageshack.us/img222/246/pic5bh0.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Follow those step to GreyScale your image.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 6:[/b]After GreyScaling and If you haven't done so [Selected the part you want] here's how to select the part you want.<below>
After when you selected the part you want, we go to Image->Adjustment->Brightness/Contraste.<below> [img]http://img213.imageshack.us/img213/5367/pic6gf6.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Crupt your image if you haven't and go to Image->Adjustment->Brightness/Contraste.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 7:[/b]Play Around with Brightness/Contraste until you are satisfied with the result. Notice: besure nathing is inside the image you are crupting. inother words the color inside your selected part should be white. make sure we could only see the outline of the object.<below> [img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/6444/pic7gr2.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]here's an example of what the Scar Icon should look like after using Brightness/Contraste.[/i][/size]
[b]Step 8:[/b]Now we Copy your finish result and open up Paint. i'm sure everyone have it. <below> [img]http://img223.imageshack.us/img223/4459/pic8uk6.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Copy finished result (Ctrl+C).[/i][/size]
[b]Step 9:[/b]Paste your finished result into Paint. (Ctrl+ V) <below> [img]http://img84.imageshack.us/img84/3917/pic9oo3.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Paste image in Paint(Ctrl+V)[/i][/size]
[b]Step 10 final![/b] Now you could use the "Zoom Tool" if you wanted. Next we select the color Black and make it the background color for our Bitmap Mask! THE END! <below> [img]http://img91.imageshack.us/img91/9175/pic10endho2.png[/img] [size=8pt][i]Make Black our background.[/i][/size]
[size=24pt][b]Conclusion[/b][/size] this should be the finish result of our bitmap mask. [img]http://img216.imageshack.us/img216/858/samplemi7.png[/img]
Using a bitmap mask is the same thing as using bitmaps except you use the findBitmapMask function. the good thing about bitmap mask is that color isn't a problem. no matter what the color is. Scar would find it! as long as the shap of the Object dosn't change. to find this function you could open up scar and press F1 and search for bitmapmask.
And last but not lease please post comments etc. and please credit Eagertolearn (i've spend like 3-4hours making this. :D). thanks.

item.title: [Tut]{Photoshop} How to make Bitmap Mask![Tut]
item.dc:creator: @eagertolearn eagertolearn
item.description:
@eagertolearn wrote:

[size=24pt]{TUT Photoshop} How to Make a Bitmap Mask by Eager.[/size]

[size=12pt]About this tutorial.[/size]
This Tutorial will teach you how to make a Bitmap Mask.bmp using photoshop. Now if any of you guys who dosen’t have photoshop DONT PANIC 'cause you could get it for free! :rolleyes: Using Torrent i’ll give you the link.

[size=12pt]Procedures[/size]

Step 1:After obtaining Photoshop. We open it. Notice: Photoshop could be obtained on this link http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,1266.0.html#post_ps

[size=8pt]Locate and open up you photoshop.[/size]

Step 2:After Opening up Photoshop you have to Creat a new project for pasting your destop snapshot. ( to make a snapshot you could just press the ‘‘Print Screen Sys Rq’’ button located beside your F12 button or you could press Ctrl+C+the ‘‘Print Screen’’ button.) After Click on File->New you should see a pop-up box. set the width and height in pixels of your windows. (if you dont know how big in pixels your windows is. Then Open up Scar use the color picker click on the very buttom of your windows the very button right hand corner and you should see the color and the coordintes. Type in the coordinats +1 so if i have ''Color Picked: 1381395 at (1023, 767) ‘’ for my color picker i would type in 1024->width and 768->height in my photoshop pop-up window.

[size=8pt]Creat a new project type in your windows width and height in pixels then press ‘‘Ok’’[/size]

Step 3:After crating a new blank page in photoshop we paste our windows snapshot by Ctrl+V. Then you crop the snapshot ( select the park that you want to make it into mask. example for mine i choose FireFox. you can select the part you wanted by selecting the squar like box at the very top-left of your photoshop tool bar.

[size=8pt]select the square like icon at the very top left hand corner of your photoshop tool bar and Select the part you wanted.[/size]

Step 4:To make accurate Crupting you could use the ‘‘Zoom tool’’ and click on the ‘‘Actual Pixel’’ Button.

[size=8pt]use the ‘‘Zoom tool’’ -> ‘‘actual pixel’’ button for more accurate cutting.[/size]

Step 5:Now we have to covert your image into GreyScale to do this you go to Image->Mode->Greyscale.

[size=8pt]Follow those step to GreyScale your image.[/size]

Step 6:After GreyScaling and If you haven’t done so [Selected the part you want] here’s how to select the part you want.

After when you selected the part you want, we go to Image->Adjustment->Brightness/Contraste.

[size=8pt]Crupt your image if you haven’t and go to
Image->Adjustment->Brightness/Contraste.[/size]

Step 7:Play Around with Brightness/Contraste until you are satisfied with the result. Notice: besure nathing is inside the image you are crupting. inother words the color inside your selected part should be white. make sure we could only see the outline of the object.

[size=8pt]here’s an example of what the Scar Icon should look like after using
Brightness/Contraste.[/size]

Step 8:Now we Copy your finish result and open up Paint. i’m sure everyone have it.

[size=8pt]Copy finished result (Ctrl+C).[/size]

Step 9:Paste your finished result into Paint. (Ctrl+ V)

[size=8pt]Paste image in Paint(Ctrl+V)[/size]

Step 10 final! Now you could use the “Zoom Tool” if you wanted. Next we select the color Black and make it the background color for our Bitmap Mask! THE END!

[size=8pt]Make Black our background.[/size]

[size=24pt]Conclusion[/size]
this should be the finish result of our bitmap mask.

Using a bitmap mask is the same thing as using bitmaps except you use the findBitmapMask function. the good thing about bitmap mask is that color isn’t a problem. no matter what the color is. Scar would find it! as long as the shap of the Object dosn’t change. to find this function you could open up scar and press F1 and search for bitmapmask.

And last but not lease please post comments etc. and please credit Eagertolearn (i’ve spend like 3-4hours making this. :D). thanks.

Read full topic
